page.title: 10St Nicholas Church,Britwell
page.content: Britwell's place of worship is St Nicholas Church, which was rebuilt in 1867 on the site of a Norman church. it is made of brick and flint and it has a bell tower on the roof. The Rector now is Reverend Membury. There have been forty nine rectors since 1234. The first incumbent was Warin de Schirebourne. The earlist date for someone to be buried in the graveyard was in 1574. He was called Mr Browne. He had seventen children. Some of his children did not survive to the age of six. Nowadays hardly anyone goes to church on a Sunday. Mr Membury said the conregation is only six, but there is a service every Sunday. Mr Membury has only been a Rector for three years. Before he became a Rector he was a worker priest in industrial training, a headmaster for seventeen years and a missionary for eleven year
